comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Edward Prentiss Costigan, US Senator from Colorado; his wikipedia entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_P._Costigan

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: As counsel for the United Mine Workers, he testified regarding the causes of the labor troubles in Colorado and the bona fides of the Rockefeller Foundation to the Walsh Commission (Commission on Industrial Relations) in a hearing on February 2, 1915 at the Metropolitan Building in New York. (Bain has a series of photos, likely taken in that building on that day of Commission witnesses.) query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00E12F83E5C13738...

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: Thanks, Penny, we'll gussy up the record.
